intro: Astragalus californicus, commonly known as California milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It plays a role in stabilizing soils and supporting local wildlife. Astragalus californicus is also valued for its ecological and potential medicinal properties.
